intro: Lens nigricans var. vulgaris, commonly known as the common lentil, is an annual legume belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its pod-like fruits that contain small, lens-shaped seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has trifoliate leaves with a distinctive dark green color. The seeds are rich in protein and are widely cultivated for food and fodder. It thrives in temperate climates and is well-adapted to various soil types.
